content.question: A <math alttext="10.0 gram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10.0</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>g</mtext></math> sample of <math alttext="P b, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Pb</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> is dissolved in distilled water and an excess of <math alttext="1.0 molar H C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>HCl</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> is added. The <math alttext="P b C l 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>PbCl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> formed is filtered and placed in an oven to dry. The final mass of the precipitate is significantly greater than predicted. Which of the following could account for the discrepancy?

choices.label: The sample of <math alttext="P b, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Pb</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> was wet.

The <math alttext="K s p " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></math> of <math alttext="P b C l 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>PbCl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> is extremely small.
The precipitate was not dried to a constant mass.

A <math alttext="3.0 molar H C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>HCl</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> solution was used instead of a <math alttext="1.0 molar H C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>HCl</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> solution.

content.answer: The precipitate was not dried to a constant mass.

skill.text: 6.G: Explain how potential sources of experimental error may affect the experimental results.
